question: [File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/driver.rs] [Function: start_driver()] [Notification Interleaving] Can the concurrent handling of different notification types at lines 224-238 cause non-atomic state changes that violate sync invariants? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/driver.rs] [Function: handle_consensus_commit_notification()] [Commit and Error Race] Can a consensus commit notification at line 317-351 race with an error notification at line 496, causing inconsistent state if both are processed concurrently? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/driver.rs] [Function: handle_snapshot_commit_notification()] [Snapshot and Consensus Commit Race] Can snapshot commits at line 471-493 race with consensus commits, causing duplicate transaction processing or version conflicts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/driver.rs] [Function: handle_error_notification()] [Bootstrap State Check Race] Is the bootstrapper.is_bootstrapped() check at line 504 atomic with the subsequent error handling, or can bootstrap state change during processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/driver.rs] [Function: check_auto_bootstrapping()] [Bootstrap Completion Error] If bootstrapper.bootstrapping_complete() fails at line 653, is the error handling sufficient or can this leave the node in a partially bootstrapped state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/driver.rs] [Function: drive_progress()] [Bootstrap to Continuous Transition] Is there proper synchronization during the transition from bootstrapper to continuous_syncer after bootstrap completion, or can sync operations be lost during handoff? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/driver.rs] [Function: check_sync_request_progress()] [Reset Stream Timing] Can the continuous_syncer.reset_active_stream(None) call at line 605 race with new sync requests, causing the new request to be incorrectly reset? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/driver.rs] [Function: handle_error_notification()] [Continuous Syncer Error Recovery] Does the continuous_syncer.handle_storage_synchronizer_error() call at lines 506-511 properly recover from all error types, or can some errors leave streams in bad states? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/driver.rs] [Function: drive_progress()] [Continuous Syncer Progress Errors] Are the errors from continuous_syncer.drive_progress() at lines 699-711 properly categorized and handled to prevent silent failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/driver.rs] [Function: drive_progress()] [Global Summary Validation] Does the aptos_data_client.get_global_data_summary() call at line 673 properly validate the summary data, or can malicious peers inject invalid data summaries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/state-sync-driver/src/driver.rs] [Function: drive_progress()] [Empty Summary Handling] Is the global_data_summary.is_empty() check at line 674 sufficient to detect all scenarios with no active peers, or can it be bypassed? (Medium)
